participant_1.name: Emily
participant_1.personality: Creative and passionate about fashion, but struggles with self-doubt.
participant_1.background: I was a teacher before I started my own clothing line. I live life to its fullest. I have been struggling with my mental health recently. I look down on people who didn’t. I'm majoring in business and love to lamp, but the hardest thing I've ever done was trying to explain this to my parents.

participant_2.name: Jason
participant_2.personality: Laid-back and supportive, enjoys hobbies and family time.
participant_2.background: I met my family through a series of awkward encounters and shared experiences. I didn’t go to college because I run the family farm. Madonna is my sister. I'm a couch potato who loves Jimmy Fallon and the Raptors. I can draw.

content.text: What do you think of the new clothing line I just released?
I love it! I'm definitely going to buy a few pieces.
Thanks! I'm really proud of it.
I can tell. It looks great.
What inspired you to start your own clothing line?
I was a teacher before, but I always loved fashion. I decided to quit my job and start my own clothing line.
That's awesome! I'm glad you followed your dream.
What's the hardest thing about running your own clothing line?
The hardest thing is probably the competition. There are so many other clothing lines out there.
I can imagine. But it sounds like you're doing great.
Well, I'm sure you'll be successful. Your clothing line is amazing.
